function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Resuspension and settling of microbes contributing to communities detected in dust.","Impact":"Increased risk of indoor microbial contamination and potential for infectious disease transmission.","Mitigation":"Regular cleaning and disinfection of indoor surfaces, improved ventilation systems, and use of air filtration technology.","Technologies":"Air purifiers, HEPA filters, UV-C disinfection systems.","People":"Building occupants, particularly those susceptible to airborne infections (e.g., immunocompromised individuals).","Owner":"Building management, facility maintenance staff."},{"Description":"Debate about the relative importance of dispersal from outdoor sources versus conditions within buildings for determining indoor microbial communities.","Impact":"Uncertainty in understanding the dynamics of indoor microbial communities and potential mismanagement of indoor environmental factors.","Mitigation":"Conducting comprehensive assessments of ventilation systems, building design, and occupancy patterns to determine the primary sources of indoor microbial contamination.","Technologies":"Indoor air quality monitors, environmental sensors, HVAC system upgrades.","People":"Building designers, environmental engineers, indoor air quality specialists.","Owner":"Facility management, building owners, governing bodies."},{"Description":"Spatial and temporal scale impact on the processes that give rise to patterns of diversity in indoor microbial communities.","Impact":"Inadequate understanding of factors influencing indoor microbial diversity and potential limitations in infection control measures.","Mitigation":"Implementing targeted sampling and analysis strategies for indoor microbial diversity, considering different spatial and temporal scales.","Technologies":"Advanced microbial sequencing technologies, environmental monitoring devices.","People":"Microbiologists, environmental scientists, public health officials.","Owner":"Research institutions, public health organizations, facility management teams."}]}
